Jonah.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: someone who seems to bring bad luck
Jonah.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: in the Old Testament of the Bible, a man who disobeyed God and tried to escape from him by getting on a ship. God caused a storm, and the other sailors threw Jonah into the sea. He was then swallowed by a Whale, and spent three days in its stomach before escaping onto land.
